thread.title: Pontus Jansson: Leeds United defender to complete move from Torino in summer - BBC Sport
thread.title_full: Pontus Jansson: Leeds United defender to complete move from Torino in summer - BBC Sport

title: Pontus Jansson: Leeds United defender to complete move from Torino in summer - BBC Sport
text:
Read more about sharing. All three of Pontus Jansson's goals for Leeds United have come away from Elland Road Leeds United will sign defender Pontus Jansson on a more permanent basis when his loan move from Italian Serie A side Torino expires this summer. 
The 25-year-old Sweden international centre-back has agreed a three-year deal, tying him to Elland Road until at least the end of the 2019-20 season. 
Loan man Jansson has played a key role in Leeds' rise up the Championship table under Garry Monk this season. 
Since arriving for the season, he has played 23 games, scoring three times. 
The latest of them was the winning goal in Wednesday's 2-1 win at Blackburn. 
Jansson, who began his career with Malmo before moving to Torino in 2014, has won 10 full caps for his country. 
Leeds are fourth in the Championship table ahead of Sunday's local derby at fifth-placed neighbours Huddersfield, who are now just a point behind them. 
Find all the latest football transfers on our dedicated page. Share this page
